newsitem.title: GERMANY: German MUM issue massively oversubscribed.
newsitem.headline: German MUM issue massively oversubscribed.

text.p: The initial public offering of shares in Germany software group Mensch und Maschine AG was massively oversubscribed, leading to an early termination of the subscription period at 1500 GMT on Wednesday, arranger DG Bank said.
The bank, which is arranging the book-building process for the issue, declined to comment further on the level of oversubscription.
The 489,000 shares on offer were offered to investors in a book-building process at a price of between 38 and 45 marks.
Traders were quoting the shares in the grey market at 70-75 marks on Wednesday.

The minimum subscription volume was 150 shares. The subscription period had been set to run from July 16 to July 18. The issue price will be announced on July 19 with shares being listed on Germany's New Market from July 21.
The company's basic capital is being raised to a nominal value of 9.5 million marks from 8.2 million marks with the issue of five-mark nominal value shares.
Adi Drotleff and his family will retain majority ownership after the bourse listing, holding 70 percent of the stock.
Bayerische Vereinsbank and Heinrich Gontard and Co are co-leaders of the consortium group. --Frankfurt Newsroom +49 69 7565251
